required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Watch Laser Acupuncture With Nasal Radiation for Prevention of Coronary Artery Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Laser Hemotherapy Trial for Coronary Artery Disease Prevention in High Risk Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the effect of low level laser blood radiation applied to all participants for prevention of coronary artery disease in patients with high risk (hypertension,high blood viscosity, hypercholesterolemia as well as related immune issues)

detailed_description.textblock: The areas of low - intensity laser use have expanded in several conditions by different mechanisms and ways. Hypertension as one of coronary artery disease risk factors and early indicator of future cardiovascular events with high blood viscosity and elevated blood cholesterol levels with immune-pathological basis became necessary issue to be handled. Low Level Laser irradiation effects on blood is very essential way in revealing the mechanisms of the action of laser radiation on biological tissues by means of changes in metabolism, leading to molecular, cellular and systemic changes.

primary_outcome.description: measuring blood pressure before and after each low level laser radiation

secondary_outcome.description: measuring changes in blood viscosity before and after low level laser radiation session
measuring changes in IL-17 level before and after low level laser radiation session
measuring of 6 minute walking test before and after low level laser irradiation as an indicator of functional capacity improving

secondary_outcome.measure: change in CD 8 (cluster of differentiation 8) level
secondary_outcome.description: measuring changes in CD 8 (cluster of differentiation 8) level before and after low level laser radiation session
measuring changes in TC (total cholesterol) level before and after low level laser radiation session

secondary_outcome.measure: change in LDL (low density lipoprotien) level
secondary_outcome.description: measuring changes in LDL (low density lipoprotien) level before and after low level laser radiation session
measuring changes in TG (triglyceride) level before and after low level laser radiation session

secondary_outcome.measure: change in HDL (high density lipoprotien) level
secondary_outcome.description: measuring changes in HDL (high density lipoprotien) level before and after low level laser radiation session

arm_group.description: Watch laser acupuncture and nasal irradiation
all the participants in this group did not receive low level laser irradiation during the study period

intervention.description: semiconductor laser therapeutic instrument irradiate the circulating blood in the vessels of left hand acupoint and the mucosal tissue in the nasal cavity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- stage I hypertensive patients
- patients from 30 to 34.9 kg/m2 body mass index
- medically stable patients
- all participants have sufficient cognition enough to understand the requirements of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of malignant disease
- smoking
- history of progressive fatal disease
- history of drug or alcohol abuse
- blood donation within at least 30 days
- pregnant, trying to be pregnant or breast feeding
- cognitive impairment that will make it difficult to partake in the study

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified participated data for underlie results reported in this trial
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: data will be available after 6 months of study completion and ending 36 months
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: proposals should directed to Dr.EbtesamNagy@cu.edu.eg. To gain access, data requestors will need to sign a data access agreement
